HEA_composition.composition: Variable, designed based on target phase (e.g., equimolar for demonstration)
HEA_composition.morphology: Ultrathin, flexible, curled nanosheets with micrometer-scale lateral size
HEA_composition.thickness_control: Thickness increases with longer reaction time or reduced glucose/glycine (Figures S4, S5)

synthesis.method: Self-lattice framework-guided strategy with Ga as a mixing assistor
synthesis.key_concept: Element bonding preference forms a 'self-lattice framework'; Ga lowers formation energy to promote high-entropy mixing state
synthesis.template_role: Glucose and glycine generate a carbon template to guide nanosheet formation (Figure S1)

reaction_conditions.temperature: Relatively low (unspecified), chosen to preserve template function
reaction_conditions.time: Variable; longer time increases nanosheet thickness (Figure S4)

morphology.SEM/AFM: Curled, flexible nanosheets with ultrathin thickness (Figure S2)

crystal_structure.XRD: Confirmed single-phase structures: Rock-salt (Fig 2a), Spinel (Fig 2b), Perovskite (Fig 2c), Fluorite (Fig 2d)
crystal_structure.SAED: Polycrystalline rings matching respective crystal structures (Figure S9)

elemental_distribution.TEM_EDS_mapping: Uniform distribution of all metallic elements (Figs 2a-d, S6, S7)
elemental_distribution.XPS: Confirmed oxidation states of all elements and presence of oxygen vacancies (Figs S8, S10-S12, S24)
elemental_distribution.note: Li confirmed by XPS due to detection limit of EDS

physicochemical_characterization.key_finding: Ga assistor enables single-phase formation by reducing formation energy; absence leads to impurity phases and elemental aggregation (Figs 3, S15-S19)

electrochemical_performance.stability: GaFeCoNiMo shows no significant degradation over 250 hours at 10 mA/cm²
proposed_enhancement_mechanism: Mo alloying modulates electronic structure and induces strain

theoretical_insight.key_result: Formation energy of the system with Ga assistor is lower than that without (Figure 3c)
theoretical_insight.mechanism_summary: The self-lattice framework (based on elemental bonding preferences) guides target phase formation. The Ga assistor thermodynamically stabilizes the high-entropy mixing state by reducing formation energy, enabling single-phase HEO synthesis.
